(10) where PAR is the incident photosynthetically active radiation (MJ m −2) per time period (e.g., day); fPAR is the fraction of PAR absorbed by the vegetation canopy calculated by the GIMMS3g NDVI dataset; ε max is the maximum LUE; C s, T s, and W s represent the downward-regulation scalars for the respective effects of atmospheric CO 2 concentration ([CO 2]), temperature ( T a), and atmospheric water demand (VPD) on LUE; and min denotes the minimum value of T s and W s.
